required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physiotherapy Treatment for Chronic Achilles Tendinopathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind Randomized Controlled Trial of Physiotherapy Treatment for Chronic Achilles Tendinopathy

collaborator.agency: Norwegian Fund for Postgraduate Training in Physiotherapy

brief_summary.textblock:
Laser treatment with the proper dosage has been found effective in the treatment of chronic Achilles tendinopathy, and animal research indicate that a combination of cryotherapy followed by LLLT could yield an even better result.
Thus, the main purpose of this project is to test if the addition of low level laser therapy can enhance the treatment result of exercise and cryotherapy in patients with chronic Achilles tendinopathy, yielding less pain and higher function.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Two identical laser devices are used, where one is active and the other is sham. One laser device has a 3x60 mW output power and the other one has 0 mW output power (sham). These are labelled with yellow or blue tape by a secretary who is otherwise not participating in the study. Since the laser device has an invisible beam (904 nm wavelength) and is of such low power that heat is not detected, both the participant and the clinician will be blinded.

primary_outcome.measure: The VISA-A questionnaire: An index of the severity of Achilles tendinopathy
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
Change from baseline to week 4 and 12

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Algometer placed upon the Achilles tendon at the most sensitive spot identified by palpation. If it is unclear what the most sensitive spot is, the algometer is placed 2 cm proximal from the calcaneus.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: The Achilles tendon is palpated by the assessor while the participant is lying prone. The participant indicates whether the pressure produces pain by answering yes/no.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: The participant stands solely on one leg and lifts the heel of the floor. The distance from the heel to the floor is measured.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with real time ultrasonography in a longitudinal and sagittal view.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Doppler activity measured with real time ultrasonography in a longitudinal and sagittal view.

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative assessment of structural changes of the Achilles tendon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Structural changes are assessed by real time ultrasonography. The structural changes of the Achilles tendon is scored as absent, mild, moderate, or severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative assessment of effusion within of the Achilles tendon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to week 4 and 12
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of effusion is assessed by real time ultrasonography. The amount of effusion within and around the Achilles tendon is scored as absent, mild, moderate, or severe.

intervention.description: LLLT, 904 nm wavelength, 3 Joules per treatment point in accordance with World Association for Laser Therapy (WALT) guidelines.
Same procedure as in the LLLT group with the exception of laser irradiation (0 mW mean output power).
Concentric and eccentric exercises with a total duration of approximately 20 minutes.
Twenty minutes of cryotherapy applied to the Achilles tendon.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Achilles tendinopathy with a minimum duration of three months, pathological appearance of the Achilles tendon with thickened tendon and structural changes of the tendons matrix.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cortisone injection within the last 6 months, systemic inflammatory disease, previous suture/surgery of the Achilles tendon, pregnancy or familial hypercholesterolemia.
